alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:18PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany, southwestern Goshen and western Laramie Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 118 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Horse Creek to near Crystal Lake Campground to Virginia Dale. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Vedauwoo, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Pumpkin Vine, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Ranchettes, Granite Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Horse Creek, Warren Af Base and Fox Farm-College. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 41. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 329 and 377. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
